events.name: Roma Cleanweb Hackathon
events.about:
THE ROMA CLEANWEB HACKATHON

The spirit of the Cleanweb Hackathon is to show what you can create in a weekend; specifically, it is the opportunity to apply web, mobile and social media technologies to resource constraint issues, such as energy, waste, transportation, and water efficiency. For an overview on Cleanweb, checkout the presentations from the “Launching Cleanweb Italy” meeting in Luiss 19/9.

Thanks to our experts and partners involved, you will also have the opportunity to learn about current challenges, open data for sustainability and state of the art in Cleanweb in the US and elsewhere in Europe.

EVENT BRIEF

The Roma Cleanweb Hackathon takes place in 48 hours the weekend of 30th November through 2nd December 2012, initiating with the kickoff, briefing, idea pitching and team-building Friday afternoon and evening.

Participants are free to propose any projects relevant to the themes listed and may make use of open data, data provided by the event partners, or bring their own data. Sunday afternoon, “live” applications are demonstrated to the jury and the public. The best of these win awards.

For details, see the schedule and rules pages.

REGISTER

Participating to the Roma Cleanweb Hackathon is free, but registration is required, both for apps team participants and for public and partners attending the kick-off Friday and the presentations Sunday.

Register NOW via our registration page and secure your seat.

JOIN US

Once you’re registered, be sure to create your profile on Hacker League, review news, and wiki pages, and create your project if you have one in mind already. This will also help us all better connect and communicate during the weekend of the hackathon.
Joining us also on Twitter @CleanwebIT and Facebook. Hashtag is #CleanwebIT.

DATA SETS & APIs

You can find Data Sets and APIs for the hackathon over at Hacker League.
